page.title: 03NATURAL HISTORY & FOOTPATHS
page.content: Nature,Footpaths Blackhead. The vegetation is very low and sparse.Some taller trees grow around Pednavounder,oak and sycamore.The elm trees are dying from dutch elm desease. The National Trust own about a Kilometre in the Downas valley where they preserve the natural vegetation.Heathers and gorse predominate but there are many rare plants. Butchers broom grows in profusion round the old Mill ruins. A dartford warbler was seen in the Downas Valley in 1982. The Coastal Footpath runs right along the top of the cliffs.There is some local disagreement about where and whether other paths exist.
